titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Augustus Elliott papers, 1849-1856 and undated.
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection consists of a diary of Elliott and loose items. Brief diary entries give an account of Elliott's voyage in 1849 from England to India and his service there. Entries beginning in 1852 describe the Second Burmese War: the taking of Martaban and Prome and the pursuit of the Burmese. Entries beginning in 1854 chiefly detail conditions in the Crimea at the end of the Crimean War.In 1856 Elliott recounted his travels in the Crimea with a party of British officers before embarking for England on June 20. Included are the names and regiment of those with whom he came into contact and those who were killed or wounded, but there are gaps in entries. Loose items, and a few diary pages, pertain to ciphers and codes. Included is a 1852 pencil drawing of the Shouey Dagon Pagoda.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: George Augustus Elliott Papers, 1849-1856 and undated., David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: British Army captain in the Eighteenth Royal Irish Regiment.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of a diary of Elliott and loose items. Brief diary entries give an account of Elliott's voyage in 1849 from England to India and his service there. Entries beginning in 1852 describe the Second Burmese War: the taking of Martaban and Prome and the pursuit of the Burmese. Entries beginning in 1854 chiefly detail conditions in the Crimea at the end of the Crimean War.

In 1856 Elliott recounted his travels in the Crimea with a party of British officers before embarking for England on June 20. Included are the names and regiment of those with whom he came into contact and those who were killed or wounded, but there are gaps in entries. Loose items, and a few diary pages, pertain to ciphers and codes. Included is a 1852 pencil drawing of the Shouey Dagon Pagoda.
